text: Draft. Cloudy amber body with a frothy white head. Aroma of spice, clove, toasted grain, mango, citrus, basement mustiness. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Good balance between hop and yeast flavors. Citrus and fruit on top of clove and mustiness. Clean malts. Nice beer.

Tap @ Mig & Ølsnedkeren, 5.9%. Hazy amber with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, caramel, orange peel, hop, spices and pepper. Flavour is malt, yeast, caramel, orange peel, notes of sourness, medium sweet, notes of spice, little pepper, little dry, little earthy and bitter.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazy orange with a good head and some lacing. Aroma of citrus, fruit, hint of yeast and spice. Taste of citrus, bit of yeast and earthiness and trace of sweetness. Some bitterness and a fairly clean finish. Medium body, nicely balanced and flavorful.

Tap at Republic with commonshawn. Snifter glass. Attractive golden orange color with a healthy full finger of white frothy head. Aroma has some interesting spice qualities almost a peppery note. Hops are present as well but subtle. Taste is also relatively subtle with hoppy bitterness present with some almost hefeweisen banana (but that seems strange). Pleasant full mouthfeel. Little bite at the end coupled with mild sweetness. Happy with this effort.

Tap at republic 7 corners with commonmac. Orange and gold with thick white foamy head. Subtle yeast Belgian nose and small hop. Taste has low hop bitterness, professional balance, quick finish. Medium dry body. Interesting combination of styles here. Good.

On tap at Republic 7C. Pours a hazy light yellow gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has grass and light fruits with some flora underlying. Flavor has light fruits, light grain and a bit of grass supporting.

Draft. Cloudy gold with an average white head. Aroma is Belgian spices, barnyard, grains, and a little lemon. Taste is sweet grains, lemon, coriander, and Belgian yeast. Average mouthfeel and slightly dry on the finish.

Draft at Gollem in Antwerp during their American weekend. Very thick, lacing, coarse, snow white head over a cloudy, deep peach blonde beer. Aroma of ripe pink grapefruit, moldy lemon, papaja, dough, honey liqueur, strawberry, ripe banana, mango, butter, green plum. Fruity onset, mango, banana, peach, softish carbo, sourish kiwi-like undercurrent, smooth, slick and fluffy malt body, sweetish, honeyish and a tad caramelly while the fruitiness goes on on top of it, yeasty touch in the end paired with a New World hop character, less bittering than aromatic with retronasal orange, pine and grapefruit effects. Could be regarded as a "Belgian IPA", which was apparently the intention, the name referring to the Van Eecke classic which is otherwise very different altogether. One for those who have no problems with Belgian yeast traits mingling with New World hop fragrance so I can imagine a concept like this will divide opinions, but in my case: very enjoyable, rich and fun beer to drink.

250 ml. draft @ Gollem. Very hazy orange, creamy white head. Nose is some milky yeast with pleasing mango, orange peel, hop is mellow, light bread. Taste is milky, grainy, mango hops, low passionfruit, quite milky & grainy, some orange sweetness, low grass. Drinks well, not bad but I feel like the BE yeast strain isnt the optimal choice here. A bit too milky & sweet to fully work for me but not bad overal.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours gold with a white head. Taste sweet, Belgian yeast, fruity. I thought this was good. I would drink this again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at the bridge. Clear gold pour with thin super lacy white head. Aroma is really grassy, light fruitiness, hoppy. Taste is grainy, light fruitiness, piney, bone dry. Palate is light med bodied with good carbonation, very dry. Tasty.

Bottle. Moderate roasted grain for the malt, light to moderate herbs and citrus for the hops, moderate dough for the yeast, with dried fruit in the background. Head is large, fizzy/frothy, white, with good lacing and good legs, and is mostly diminishing. Color is murky medium amber/tan. Flavor starts lightly sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and lightly to moderately bitter. Palate is medium, oily, with a fizzy carbonation and a tart finish. An easy drinking Belgian Ale, perfect accompaniment for a big dinner

Draft:
Orange-pulp looking appearance, with an off-white head.
Orange-malt and grapefruit-peel scent.
Yeast, orange malt, fruit flavour.
APA-like hopping...
Really wonderful.
Moderate grain aroma with a very light amount of hops. Hazy golden color with a very large white head. Good balance of malt and hops in the flavor with a lightly bitter finish.
Another great offering from an amazing brewery! Dry, effervescent, love the hop aroma. Perfect table beer for me!

On tap. Pours a cloudy pale amber with a thin but resilient white head. Aroma is musty with coriander and other spices. Taste is sweet pale malt, honey, peppery, bready, yeasty with a distinct hop bitterness not all that typical in a Belgian ale. Good, quite good.
Light color, with grassy and with a peppery and bitter finish. Notes of pine resin and a long finish.

Tap at sb. Pours a murky burnished dark amber with a loose sudsy white head. Big sweet floral grassy piney nose. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Grassy, piney, minerally mid palate. Long dry finish.

Hazy gold with a thin foamy cap. Lovely aroma of honey and lemon citrus and the lightest bit of white pepper. Musty flavor with yeast and honey and a certain blonde breadiness all over the place, some white pepper and Belgian tree fruity esters, light honey, grassy dry hop bitter tones, and a yeasty Belgian blonde malt/white peppery finish.
Pours a golden color. Has a nice belgian flavor. Lingers a bit to long but a good beer overall.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Krone - pretty hazy dark red.orange beer under a solid creamy and long lasting pale beige foam; gently perfumy and estery with notes of watermelon and pears; a good malt backbone, clean, rounded and tasty; fairly sweet, very subtle and moderate carbonation, quite dry and decently bitter; long hoppy finish of quince and melon

Draft at hopleaf. Cooper/orange assistance with decent head with lacing and some carbonation. Ipa citrus aroma. Hot with plenty of orange and pineapple. Clean, clean. This is really good. Nice spice on the back. I am really loving this.

Draft @ Taphouse, Copenhagen. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty weak hoppy aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty finish.

Draught at Taphouse.
Clear amber colored with a medium sized white.
Fruity aroma of caramel, hops and pine needles with notes of spices.
Fruity flavor of hops, spices and pine needles.
Hoppy finish.
Draught at Taphouse, Copenhagen. Clear golden - white head. Sweetness. Yeasty. High eastery. Spicy. Light eartjhy. Light banana notes. Ok bitterness. A bit dryness in the finish. Hmmmm.
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is estery and fruity. Bitter. Estery and fruity. Dry and herbs. Bitter and dry estery finish.

On tap, poured into a snifter. The aroma is mellow juicy citrus with a pepper touch and a light pastry dough hint. Its a murky honey gold with a  white, frothy head and a messy and sudsy lace. A medium soapy ring is retained with a soft, thin, dusty and splotchy surface. The taste is a medium sweet and bitter, slightly more bitter than sweet. The beer is creamy but light on the palate with a soft foamy carbonation and a medium light body. Flavors of lemon, grass, bread crust, and a light cardboard, are noted with a late peach sweetness. The finish is peppery and dry with an aftertaste of white pepper. Its dry, lightly astringent, and it pairs well with rich, buttery foods.

This brew has a crystal amber body with a layered cream bubble head--quite appealing a appearance. The aroma and body are fairly consistent, characterized by crystal candy and leafy hop noses, with good overall balance.

On tap at Capitol Beer & Tap Room. Pours Cloudy golden with a thick white head and a fruity aroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a little banana ester and a dry fairly bitter finish. Nice yeast presence.

Tap at Beveridge Place, Seattle. Colour is clear light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, hints of tropical fruits, Belgian yeast and malts. Very fruity Belgian ale like most of the American Belgian ales.

Tap@ Special Brews. Clear amber color with ivory head. Dusty pale malt, spicy yeast, light fruit, earthy hop aromas.  Medium body with average co2.  Nice earthy aged pale malt, spicy yeast, light fruit flavors with a smooth finish----very tasty
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Bottle. Pours crystal clear orange, large off-white head, dissipates slowly, good lacing. Aroma is corn, Belgian yeast, light lay, dust. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, nutty, kind of a bocky malt profile. Medium body, high carbonation.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar, SF. Pours orangey amber. Oranges and spicy fruit aroma. Potently bitter, slightly acidic orange zest flavours. Complex.
Draft. Unclear dark orange gold. Frothy off white head. Great modest hoppiness, especially in aroma. Fruity. A fun Belgian ale.

On tap @ the Pine Box, Seattle. Light clear orange, persistent white head. Grassy and lemon rind aroma. Pale cereal malts, grassy/vegetal hops with citrus undertones and a drying pithy bitterness in the finish.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Draft pour at Chucks CD. Light golden pour, slight sour aroma with floral and hop taste.
Floral, grassy, fragrant hop aromas, spice, citrus, stonefruit. Hazy orange with a fully lasting white head. Fruity, fresh hop flavors. Medium bodied.

Growler, courtesy of a kind soul... shared in a location remote of my dining room. 
Pours a hazy bolonde with a smallish head and some decent lacing on the glass.

The aroma is bright & fruity with some limestone and lots of fruity hops. Its got a little bit of peppercorn and spiciness to it, but its mostly earthy with bright hoppiness. 

The flavor is fruity and hop forward. Its lightly bitter with some lemon rind, apricot and a nice minerallity. Itd put it at about a medium dryness. 

Totally enjoyable on all levels.
On tap at the abbey. Amazing stuff, hoppy floral flavors and a creamy feel, great sticky beer.

Tap at the Watershed. 
Listed as Perennial Hommel Bier Dry Hopped. 
Deep copper-orange pour, delightful hop-forward nose, lovely belgian character driven not by the esters but rather something else about how the yeast interplays with the hops. Delicious, delicious stuff. i could drink this all night. Another huge winner from Perennial.

Serving: Draft at MacDowell Brew Kitchen. It pours a medium amber with a lasting white head. Plenty of lacing left behind too. Light nose with a bit of yeast and citrus. Yeast, light citrus pith, grass, and a slightly spicy finish. Overall very mellow and easy drinking. Well made and worth seeking out.
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo NY. golden pour, citrus jam, nectarine, bretty dryness, bandaids, stone fruits. nice bitterness. enjoyable

A- Pours as light orangey hue with a frothy, creamy, off white head that leaves plenty of lacing on the way down.

S- spicy, yeasty, sharp

T- Peach, apricot, nectarine, leading into spicy notes, belgian yeast, citrusey hops, lingering bitterness.

M- Medium bodied with ample carbonation.

D- Very drinkable brew. Not a huge fan of the style but this one is really approachable and impressive.
Tap at Perennial. Slightly hazy orange pour with a spotty white head. Resin and citrus aroma. Yeasty. Light on the palate, yet a little prickly. Very good.

Gold pour with creamy white head and lace. Aroma is light brown sugar, Belgian yeast, and a touch of resiny hops. Medium light maltiness and brown sugar with a medium/light hop bitter finish., Medium bodied with good carbonation.
Draft sample at the oktoberfeast in the south street seaport. Belgian hoppy sweet taste with as nice profile. Decent

Draft pour at Special Brews. Pours a litgher golden color with a lasting head to it. A slightly soapy citrus aroma. Very unique IPA here for me, likely because Im not entirely familiar with Belgian IPAs. A lot of citrus fruit flavor with a decent bitter finish. Good amount of flavor going on. A new experience for me. Enjoyable. Good beer overall.

[ Tap ][ 10oz ][ @Menomale ][ $9 ][ snifter ][ 8/15/14 ]Hazy gold, tepid top with thin white ring, light lacing. Doughy nose, heavy honey sweetness with light acidity, citrus, peppery grass, light dirty yeast esters. Plastic hint front palate, incredibly juicy tangerine, melon, with low carbonation at front. Dusty grass emerges mid, high minerality in absence of malt through finish, more yeast presence in faint gum, booze definitely noticeable through thin, fizzy finish.

Draft. Gold pour, white head. Good retention/some lace. Aroma is estery, dough, citrus, grassy. Taste is lightly bitter, ester, bread, earth, grass. Palate has average carbonation, slick, light bitter finish.

Sample at Birch And Barley/Churchkey. Clear orange-yellow color with a medium fluffy white head that dissipates gradually to an outer ring. Strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of herbal yeast, citrus and hops. Light to medium body with flavors of citrus, yeast, floral hops and malt. The finish is fruity with a floral hops aftertaste. Above average overall.
carried over from untapped to try and organize my beers in one spot for synchronicity.
Draft. Pours gold with a white head. Wheaty base, with some spicy yeast, faint banana-like fruity notes, and a light spritzy/seltzer quality. Pretty good.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a tulip. Pours clear light orange with huge white head. Aroma is floral hops, medium body, medium carbonation, and some big bubble lacing. Taste is floral hops, spicy hops, earthy yeast, and dry finish. Good Belgian Ale.

[Tap] Slightly hazy bright amber pour. Large cap of white head. Nice hop aroma is accented by straw notes, yeasty esters and white pepper. Taste includes spicy Belgian yeasts, pine, pineapple, orange zest and also floral notes. Rich mouthfeel. Dry finish. Another nice beer from Perennial.
Not one of my favorite perennial beers, but it is a flavor filled Belgian with a bit of a bitter long finish.
A big dirty hay taste here which is great. Finishes a little sour, some funk. Very light Belgian yeast and some bubblegum. Pours orange without much head or lacing. On tap at DC Beer Festival.

A lightly hazed golden ale with a thin lacing white head. In aroma, sweet caramel malt with smooth floral hops, nice. In mouth, a light caramel malt with light grassy floral hops, faint citrus, light bodied, OK. On tap at Corner Foodery.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2014 Bottle: Thanks, Jason! Super hazy, goldenrod body with a foamy, white head that fizzles down into a swampy film & chunky collar. Aroma is full force Belgian yeast with a light farmhouse-y funk, hints of lemon & lactic tartness, a touch of grass, & a faint, biscuit undercurrent. Taste is very dry with lots of farmhouse & woody funk, notes of cobweb & cellar floor, mild lemon flesh & stone fruit skins with a sharp, yeast filled finish... A hint of baked bread, leading into a bone-dry, horsey aftertaste. Sharp, carbonated mouth feel... Decent Belgian ale. Fairly light, quite funky, & super dry on the palate.
Draft pour at unite urban grill Orange cloudy pour. White foamy head. Bitter and hoppy grapefruit and lemon taste. Not IPA in my mind but a good beer.

Pour on tap at Black Bottle, clear orange-yellow pour with white head, aroma brought notes of biscuit, bread, white fruit, hints of earth, slight lemony notes, into a bit of grain. Taste is a mix of white fruit, biscuit, bread, yeast, hints of grain, finishing fairly dry, slightly bitter.

Aroma: Belgian Yeast, Floral, Mild Citrus Zest

Appearance: Orange/Golden Straw Hue, Passes Most Light, Thin White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Lemon Zest, Mildly Floral, Mildly Spicy, Mild Yeast

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying

Draft at Khyber Pass. Pulled a dark orange with a pillowy white head. Runny lace. Fragrant citrus floral nose. Spicy tangerine marmalade on toasted Challah bread. Dark orange shortbread. Red grapefruit pips. Sweet plummy honey with a dry spicy finish.

Draft at railroad. Pours somewhat clear orange with a medium sized white head. The aroma has some lemon zest, orange, peach, peppery spice, a bit yeasty. The taste is dry, lemon, peppery, a bit dry on the finish.

750ml bottle, shared by beerpig317. Totally hazy orange yellow color. Thin off-white head. Thicker ropes of lace. Some burnt sugars in the nose. Light metallic, caramel malts, light citrus hop. Smooth, lighter kind of soft carbonation. Good herbal character to it. Light bitter, moderate sweet. Medium-plus body. Smooth, soft, lighter carbonation. Lightly dry finish. Solid belgian ale. Smooth and easy drinking. Liked it more and more as I went.

Tap at dodge city. Pours clear golden amber with creamy white head. Aroma is belgian yeast, candy sugar, bready and cookie malts, light fruit, and floral notes. Flavor is dry malt base with floral hop bitterness, light grapefruit, and light toast; dry finish with some lingering bitterness. Medium body and low carbonation.
Draft. Pours clear copper gold with a thin white head. Tastes sweet, fruity, slightly sour. Light body and low carbonation. Smells like apples, peaches, cherry, wheat and malt.
Nice belgian style IPA. Good fresh hop flavors but i wish it had some more alcohol and bit a little harder.
Draft. Pours golden with a nice white head. Big pineapple, citrus, and yeasty aroma. Taste is pineapple, Belgian yeast, orange zest. Crisp finish.
On draft at lost dog in McLean. Pours a clear copper with an off white head. Yeast aroma. Kind of a hopped version of a true Belgian ale. Flavors are of grassy and resinous hops. Decent.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good for the style; a hazy burnt orange with ample white head that slowly dissipates into lacing. Smells and tastes solid; Belgian yeast, hops, and spice. Nice on the palate. Good beer.

Bottle from Dad. No bottle date but worried I let this sit around for too long. Oh well. Pours a light copper/dark gold color with big fast creamy frothy head. Lots of bubbles coming up from the bottom. Aroma of earthy yeast and hop, orange, pine, dirt, hay. Flavor is earthy yeast, straw, and maybe some stale hops. Probably let this sit a little long but not bad. Yeasty farmhouse funk. Easy drinking and plenty of carbonation.
Nice. Good clean drinking beer. Had this at the Beer Geeks of Northwest Arkansas thanks to Matt.

Crisp copper coloured body with a frothy, soapy off-white head about four centimetres thick and literally a zillion small bubbles rising from the bottom. Aroma of fresh grassy and herbal hops, yeast, pepper, herbs, barnyardie funk and some nice mellow malt - very nice and complex. Medium-bodied; Strong dry and grassy hop flavours up front with some mellow yeast, a touch of light earthy malt and a bit of biscuits tucked inside some herbs. Aftertaste shows a very light and herbal note, some light hop bitterness, but mainly a dry, airy and subtle flavour - nothing overwhelming and nothing too great, actually. Overall, a decent beer, but not showing enough complexity on the finish to be great - the smell is there and complex, but dies after the nose. After sampling too many good belgies in ~2 weeks in Belgium, being home for less than a week made me underappreciate this beer - its good, but simply doesnt compare with real belgies. Still nice to try of course, despite the high price. I sampled this 75 cL bottle purchased from Whole Foods in New York (Columbus Circle), New York on 12-July-2013 for US$12.99 sampled at home in Washington on 28-August-2013.

9 oz. At Range Burgers. Pours a copper with clear body. Aroma has distinct vanilla, almost like cream soda. There are subtle malt notes. Lots of vanilla in the flavor, peculiar Belgian ale. The finish is short and lets out some banana hints. Not much hop presence.

Pours a golden haze with a profound carbonation, creating a fluffy and sticky foam head. The aroma is of floral hops, citrus, malts, spices, and yeast. It is very pleasant. The flavor is freshing. It has a defined pale malt like character, mild bitterness, citrus tones, and a mild yeast taste. In the finish I noticed a calming bitterness, malt taste, and yeast flavor that sticks around. Overall I liked this and was worth purchasing.

Bottle at home. Pours hazy orange with a large, frothy white head, medium retention with excellent lacing. Aroma is fresh, earthy and spicy hops, light toast malt, Pils and cracker malt with Belgian yeast spices. Flavor is crisp malt, moderate hops and bitterness, spicy Belgian yeast notes and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

Draught from the brewery. Pours cloudy orange, with a thin but lacing head. Nose shows bright, earthy hops. Resin and citrus. Bitter and then dry on the finish. Some floral notes, but more on the earthy side of flowers. Dirt included in the flowerpot, I guess. In a good way.

Draft at Beer Run. Pours a clear golden color with a large creamy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of spicy, herbal hops and a musty note. The taste is herbal, spicy hops, medicinal bubblegum (kids amoxicillin), bitter finish. Medium bodied.

On tap at Capones, Norristown. Cloudy deep orange pour, nice filmy head on it. Super dry nose, pungent and very inviting, with a pronounced earthiness to it. Playful mouthfeel, lightly bitter on the dry finish. Flavors are really nice, with a seriously earthy yeast core that brings together floral and bitter notes alike, with light spice on the finish. Very enjoyable.

Bottle. Pours gold with a quickly settling white head. Nose is Belgian yeast and apricot. Taste is very earthy and spicy. Cereal grain and a touch of citrus at the end. Palate is crisp and prickly. Very unique. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught at Rattle ´n Ham, NYC. Clear pale golden beer with a big offwhite lacy head. Fruity and hoppy aroma. Hoppy and fruity flavour, a nice and refreshing beer :-)

Bottle. Clear golden hued body with a lasting white head with good lace. Aromas are floral, light citrus, medium esters, and spicy hops/phenols. A touch of isoamyl acetate. Flavors are extremely bitter, a touch vegital, light citrus, not a huge amount of hop flavor, just mostly bitterness, medium esters. Very lively carbonation. Dry.

The aroma is light and slightly floral with a hint of grain. Initial flavor is very unique with a grain character and accompanied by a chalky mouthfeel. This fades to a more typical Belgian expression with yeast balance by lively hops. Malt notes linger, adding depth.
Draft at Alla Spina. Pours a cloudy golden orange with one finger of bubbly white head and thick rings of lace. Nose of grass, pale malts, citrus and yeast spice. Medium body and carbonation.

Hazy orange pour with a frothy, well-sustained head - nose of spicy and citric American hops, lightly musty yeast, earthy malt, tangy citrus - smells more like an American IPA than a Belgian ale, but still nice - full, frothy carbonation in the mouth - flavor is medium dry, with crackery malts, crisp hop bitterness - a bit of earthiness, metallic notes, dusty/basement yeast late, followed by lingering, lightly sweet orange zest and a light herbal note - its a good beer, but not for the price - nice to try a Perennial brew, though.

bottle shared by mathieuc, thanks! pours cloudy pale yellow with a very nice whtie head, good retention and strong lacing. fresh graininess, lemons, citrus, spices, yeast - light funky bretts too, pepper, vegetal and earthy hops, dry bittering herbs. bright to average carbonation, light body - some texture,nice and unbland herbal-grassy-citrusy finish. very nice offering!

Bottle from a trade with AlexFields, thank you sir! Pours a clear golden with a fair white head. Aroma is hoppy and quite a typical belgian (fruity, spices).  Taste is medium sweet with a nice and soft bitterness. It isnt described as a Belgian IPA because it isnt but its a really nice and hoppy belgian ale!

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by mathieuc, thanks! Clear orange/golden with a huge white head and decent lacing. Aroma is of floral notes, hops, light sweetness, malt, Belgian yeast and light fruits. Taste is slightly to moderately sweet with floral notes, malt, light fruity notes and light bitterness. Medium body. Slightly dry. Good hoppy Belgian Ale. Refreshing.

not hand you idiot .. . pours a deep gold .. . good head, lacing is frothy .. . light sweetness, yeast, mild bitterness, and horse chewed hay .. . mild mouth .. . clean simple finish .. . . i can count to potato!

Special batch Dry Hopped with Simcoe and Mosaic. Should be a different entry.I didnt expect as dramatic effect ont he dry-hopping, they really wnet for it. Definite tropical and fruit aroma. The beers flavor is standard. A pleasant and hoppy belgian ale.
Draft at Capones.  Pours hazy gold with off-white head.  Nose is yeasty pale malt, hopcitrus.  Tastes citric, with bready pale malt, yeast, pineapple, and white pepper.  Smooth complex finish.
On tap at Capones. Poured a golden color with a small sized head. Fruity, floral, some spices and yeast.

Draft at the Bridge. Pours golden with a half inch of white foam. Slight fruity hop note on the nose. Nice balance of Belgian yeast, floral hops, and a touch of malt on the tongue. Finishes clean. Solid!

Clear dark yellow, no head. Light Belgian fruitiness and some peppery notes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a murky orange color with a BIG fluffy white head that leaves lace as it descends from the rim of my glass. Hops...wait a minute hops? Yes, hops is the initial aroma of the Belgian Ale! Nice aromatic citrus hops mixed with some fruity Belgian notes. Medium mouthfeel. Smooth, orange with a nice little citrus hop wallop in the back end that lingers. This is a very nice beer!

Bottle - 750mL crowned. Hazy amber with a tall, fluffy white head. Aroma is fruity and floral with plentiful hops, citrus notes, flowers, soft yeast and light malt notes. Taste is hoppy, but more floral and earthy, with citrus notes, malty notes, yeast, soft hop resins and toasted bread. Body is medium with a strong, lively carbonation. Ends with more yeast notes, floral hops, soft citrus, earthy hops, light caramel, toasted malt and grains.
750 ml. bottle. Pours hazy amber with an offwhite head. Aroma of yeast, citrus, clove. High carbonation. Finishes dry. I liked this one.

A cloudy apricot color with big fizzy head and decent lacing.  Smell is light with some citrus and Belgian yeast character and spiciness.  Taste is somewhat citrusy with earthy and spicy notes.  Has a plastic taste that I don't like but little bitterness.   Mouthfeel is soft and light bodied with high carbonation.  Was disappointed, may have been old. 

---Jeremy H

2013 bomber to a snifter.  Pours a hazy golden orange with big fizzy white head.  Aroma is earthy with a little citrus.  Taste is earthy and a little spicy with an almost plastic taste.  A little hops and orange, but very faint.  A bitterness comes at the end but is cleaned away by the intense carbonation.  Finishes dry and clean.  Watery mouthfeel.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours amber golden orange with a creamy big white head. Aroma brings cliche Belgian sweeter yeast with hints of orange. Flavor brings oranges and sweet yeast ending with a wonderful American hop influence, bringing a balanced bitterness.
Overall: Spicy, yeasty, hoppy. A bit unbalanced.Note: Bottle at Linköping Beer Expo. Reviewed 2013-03-09.

On tap for the Perennial event at Bainbridge. Pours cloudy orange with medium to large white head. Nice lacing patterns. Aromas and taste are belgian pale malts, hops, spice, and orange zest. I like prefer american pales but this one was impressive.

750ml in a Trappist glass.  Pours cloudy golden with a white head.  Aroma of spicy yeasts, citrusy hops, and some sweet, caramel and pale malts.  Flavor the same with a nice balance of everything.  Average texture.  A good beer that blends hoppiness with Belgian yeast characteristics well.

On tap half pint at Gilly's Craft Beer & Wine in Rockville, MD. 

Clear, medium dark copper-amber with a creamy off-white head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of orange, citrus, yeast, bread, spice, caramel and herbal hops.

Taste of citrus, floral hops, bitter herbs, yeast, bread, spice, rotting trees and pepper.

Medium body and high/medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750 bottle. Poured hazy yellow with a nice white head. Nice smooth hoppy nose. Taste is very mild hops and a bit wheat. A nice Belgian style mix of IPA and saison. NIce beer.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: bottle. pours orange with massive frothy creamy head. big grass aroma. taste is very bitter fruity and astringent

Tap - pours totally cloudy, dark orange gold, small white head, diminishing. Light dough, farmhouse yeast, hops and soapy notes. Taste is austere with old world grain, light dough notes, citrus hops and grain. Medium bodied, dry finish. Ok.
Nose is very light and floral with a touch of light citrus in the aroma. Moderate bitterness. Bit grainy in the finish. Slight tannins.
Draft at Churchkey.  Very cloudy peach pour. Nose of beautiful orange and apricot mixing with fantastic bready belgian doughy yeast. Good sweetness but dry finish. I like this a lot.

This beer pours a hazy brownish gold color with a large persistent head, and the aroma is spruce and floral hops. The taste is mildly sweet, slightly bitter, and slightly sour, which isnt that unpleasant; furthermore, the medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation, and slightly bitter finish combine quite nicely for a pleasant mouth feel.

Pours a ightly hazy golden amber with a medium creamy white head.  Aroma of spicy and fruity belgian yeast notes along with a nice citrusy hop nose.  Flavor of bready malt, fruity and spicy belgian yeast and again finished off with a nice citrusy hop profile.

750ml bottle served in a tulip. Poured a pretty, clear gold with a couple of fingers of fine bubbled white head. Aroma was a little yeasty with a nice hit of clove. Crisp and dry, light bodied. More clove in the finish along with some citrus and a decent amount of hop bitterness. Fairly carbonated. Very easy drinking. The best beer from Perennial out of the three that I have tried so far.
Poured from tap gold with a white head. Aroma of yeast, floral notes, cereal, and some hop. Tastes same as smell.

This is a beautiful, charming beer. Pale golden with greenish hue, fine white foam. Floral, spicy white pepper, traces of pine in the nose with little in the way of typical farmhouse aromas. In the mouth, theres a sharp bitterness to start melting into rustic apples and hay and then balancing sweet lines of biscuit. Lightly creamy on the tongue. Finishing too in a citric, acidic sharpness. I would like to have a lot of this. Thanks so much to Seth!

This is my first beer from this brewery.  The pour is a golden color with a thick fluffy head on top that sheds a lot of lacing.  The aroma at first indicates some sweetness with apple, pear, and dates.  Light clove and straw notes join in with whiffs of yeast.  This is very crisp and fairly clean; some mild esters but not a lot of fruity flavors.  Dry and bitter with a healthy dose of herbal/earthy hops and a grassy character.  Nice stuff.  Im definitely looking forward to trying some of their others.
Good smooth hoppy beer. Nothing too special, but not bad either. It didn't really stand out from other hoppy beers. Probably not worth the high price though
UPDATED: MAR 8, 2013 Pours golden orange   aroma is light citrus notes and spice   taste is  bread, cereal, spicey corriander and and pepper and finishes lemon flavors  very dry

8oz Draft A - Pours a hazy golden a nice frothy white head. Good lacing. S - Yeasty banana, spice, some earthy notes as while. T - Spice, sweet malt & bitter hops. M - Medium bodied with a smooth texture. Good carbonation. A crisp/dry finish. Could drink quantity of quality. O - A Solid Belgium Style Ale.
On tap.  Comes dark orange with a nice white head.  Aroma of malt, yeast, citrus, and spice.  Taste is malt, lemons, oranges, spices, grass, and yeast.  Very enjoyable.
January 24, 2013 on tap at brewery. Clear orange pour with some head and lacing. Aroma and taste of spice, belgian yeast and earthy/floral hops.

On tap Very nice saison/Belgian style that balances the yeast really well. A faint banana yeasty aroma topped with a well balanced yeasty body. But not too yeasty, and that sets this bee apart from other American variations. Very nice

Location: 750 ml bottle from Whole Foods-Bowery, 1/3/13


Aroma: The nose is clean and hoppy, with some grass, Saison yeast, lemon, and earth

Appearance: It pours a hazed golden-orange color with a huge froth of lacy, off-white head

Flavor: It has light sweetness, lots of grass, spice, and earth, and a light-medium bitter hoppiness

Palate: The body is medium, it has a lively carbonation, feels a touch slick, and has a bit of dryness

Overall Impression: 
This was the first beer Ive tried from Perennial, and I actually quite liked what they did here.  Its almost like an Pale Ale-Saison mixture, but not exactly.  It has a Belgian feel for sure.  I dont know how to classify this, so Belgian Ale seems perfect.  Its a little overly carbonated, which hurts the drinkability a bit, but overall, its really quite enjoyable.
Floral aroma.  Nice bitterness.  Kind of like an ipa with Belgian yeast.  Thin head.  Lasting bitterness.

750mL bottle, sent from tstockstrom (thanks Chuck), pours a hazy golden / copper with a substantial white foamy head. Aroma is full of doughy notes, with loads of Belgian yeast, with a little spicy and some orangey fruits. Flavour reveals earthy notes, Belgian yeast and dough above all, with a very slight hint of orangey fruitiness. Quite earthy and doughy, with a hint of spice on the finish. Not as good as Id hoped for - the nose is much more inviting than the flavour profile. Still, decent stuff.

750ml split at DC tasting.  Thick, bright tan, steady long lasting foamy white head.  Really true to style, this has a great authentic mouthfeel.  Nice delicate straw, noble, hop.  Smooth, easy medium, light body.  Wow.  World class.

75cl bottle, thanks noodleuser.  Large off-white head, hazy amber body.  Aroma is medium sweet, earthy, bread, some grassy.  Taste is medium sweet, earthy/grassy, some bread, lemon.  Light-medium body, some acidity, somehwat watery, fairly drinkable.

Bottle shared by Noodleuser. Thanks! Poured a cloudy, orange-yellow color with a medium sized white head. Aroma was notes of herbs, some yeast and spices in there. Flavor had notes of spice, sweetness, touch of yeast.

Bottle shared by noodleuser. Thanks man!

The beer is hazy and golden hued with a half inch or so of white head. The aroma brings spice, straw, grass, herbal scents, yeast. The flavor follows the nose to a tee. A touch of bready sweetness, biscuits, fruit, before finishing crisp and dry. Light to medium in body. A solid beer.

750mL thx to noodleuser. Full cloudy orange. Thick doughy and yeasty nose. Estery. Taste is spicy, crackery, doughy, a bit bland with mild paper and whole wheat bread. Ok. Not offensive. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared by Noodleuser: pours a slightly hazy deep golden with a stringy-lacing white head. Has a fresh herbal hoppy nose with a touch of biscuity malts. Starts with good fullness and fine carbonation with light floral hop flavor and a touch of light fruits before a drier bittersweet finish. Well-balanced and smooth.
Bottle courtesy of noodleuser, thanks!  Murky orange, thick white head. Aroma of orange and vanilla cream with some tropical fruit. Taste is bitter and fruity straw. Nice.

Draft at perennial, pours golden with foamy white head. Aroma is real floral and spicy, good spicy character. Flavors balance spicy and sweet, big spicy yeast kicking with floral notes and sweet bread. Clean finish. Good stuff!

Tasted on 9/21/12 from a capped 750mL bottle brought to me by a friend, big thanks to Ken. Pours hazy but bright orange with a very thick white head that slowly recedes to thick, rocky lace. The nose is earthy malt and spicy Belgian yeast with some nice green hops aroma as well. The flavor is a bit more malt forward with caramelized orange peel coming through nicely, some earthy flavors, and plenty of spicy yeast. It is very dry. The body is light with lively, stinging carbonation, and a long, very dry, spicy yeast, and earthy finish.

Really nice citrus balanced by an earthy Ness. Yeast hop interplay is whats up and its badass. Orange rind.  Rocky head on a clear honey body. Totally defined by the yeast hops interplay. Really great year rounder.

Acquired in a trade. Enjoyed at home in a wine glass at 60 degrees F. 

A - Beautiful clarity on this. Burnt orange appearance. 4 finger head that fades to a finger after a few minutes. Nice lacing!

S - Smells gorgeous! Nice piney bitterness mixed with a sweet lemony texture. Bready and citrus. 

T - Tastes almost like it smells. Theres not as much bitterness in the taste. Pine Needles and Orange zest. Very earthy and muted citrus and bitter hops. Sort of a saison taste at the finish.

M - High carbonation, medium body.  It really bubbles up on the mouth swish.

O - Very enjoyable! I love that its under 6% ABV. Makes it an easy drinker.

Bottle from pantanap...thanks Kan! - Pours hazy light amber with a big frothy white head. Nose is a bit of plastic, dry, peppery malt, light toast, and a light herbal hoppiness. Hints of tropical fruit. Taste doesnt have the plastic note. Its a nice balance between the dry, lightly fruity malt, light peppery spicing, and grassy, herbal hopping. A bit astringent on the finish, and a smooth, velvety carbonation on the medium body.

Bottle at CBF. This brews character is grassy, herbal, and slightly dank. slight vegetal earthy tree note. malts are toasted dough with a touch of caramel. light belgian yeast fruit note. hop forward belgian pale ale.

Pours a cloudy orange, huge fluffy white head. Aroma of green tropical fruit, mango, yeast, funk. Medium bodied, vinous, good acidity, flavors of green table grapes, coriander, white pepper, barnyard yeast, fruity but not sweet, hoppy finish.

Pouring at Belgian Beer Fest.  Pours a mostly clear amber with a thin white head.  Musk, bright yeast, big citrus and hops.  Medium bodied, spicy hops, bitter yeast and malt.  Crisp lemon, toast, caramel.  Long tart musk and earthy bitterness.
UPDATED: JAN 12, 2013 Bottle.  Pours a golden-orange color with white head.  Grainy, earthy, hoppy, flavor. Updated rating at Perennial. More refreshing on tap.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2013 Bottle @ Brads house Minneapolis, courtesy of jcnielsen. Pours a touch hazy, orange appearance with an off white head. Fairly grapefruity, grassy, a touch piney hoppy, orange citrusy, a bit yeasty aroma. A touch funky, barnyard, somewhat spicy yeasty, somewhat bready, somewhat citrusy flavor. Pretty easy to drink and packs a pretty heavy hop punch.

On tap at the annual CBS picnic, and self served to clear plastic with a hazed, orangy gold tone, off white head foam that quickly diminished to a ring & film, and some etched-like cling to the lacing. The nose was floral and spice, light yeast, and light fruit & citrus. The flavor added mild malt, moderate but smoothed hop bitterness, medium to light body, and soft carbonation. Just sessionable for the occasion.

Golden beer with a small but lasting white head. Hoppy yeasty aroma, spicy, hay, pepper, some fruits, citrus, floral notes, some banana. Hoppy spicy flavor, pepper, hay, clove, quite bitter, perfume, floral, herbal, peppery. I like the attitude in this beer, lots of hops but still remaining a belgo style beer. Long bitter finish with pepper, yeast, fruit and some hay.

full of fruitpunch and tropical fruit flavor not overdone and still beery with light enough balanced flavors of resinous pine and citrus hop with   toffee barley malt. a bit of farina yeast for mouthfeel and dimension and a touch of fructose. marvelous and a treat.

Seductive farmhouse-style ale with clever hopping. Tough to categorize, and I find it compelling. Ruddy gold color, fruity hop nose that is hard to pin down... citrus, black currant, light touch of resin. Firm and friendly bitterness, with an impression of sweetness coming from a light touch of caramel flavor. Zesty, fruity hop flavor. I expected the classic Dupont mold, but this is something original. I like the reaonable abv. A quibble with the cost, as $10 for a 75cl locally seems rough compared to $8 or $9 for imported Saison Dupont. Would prevent me from drinking this as often as Id like.
Pours hazy orange.  Notes of yeast that dominate with a nice long finish of cloves.  Nice complexity dominates the finish.

Draft at Jerrys. Gold with good, creamy, white head / Bright, hoppy nose of weed, cream, and citrus / Medium body, somewhat fat with soft carbonation, fruity but dry with just a hint of sweetness, and good, very bitter finish / Elegant flavors of pineapple, grapefruit, orange, pine, and resin / Its a terrific American pale.

Its really earthy and yeasty, with almost a lager-like finish. Hops are lingering, but not tingling if ya know what I mean.

Reminds me very much of the Poperings Hommel Bier. Its a Belgian taste that takes some getting used to.

Bottle... Hazy golden ale with a mid-sized, fragile, white head. Good retention. The nose is a spicy, fruity blend of clove and banana with a rumor of tangerine. Medium-bodied with jazzy carbonation. The flavor is plenty bitter, offering spicy hops and pale malts. Finishes moderately bitter and dry.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle into a tulip glass.

Pours a hazy gold with a huge pillowy three finger head that has great retention and leaves abundant lacing. A very subtle but pleasant aroma of Belgian tripel yeast and hops that add floral tones and herbal accents. Extremely well-balanced flavor that includes tones of pear, a bit of bitter apple, herbs, flora and earthy accents. Finishes crisp and dry with just a slight bite from the bittering hops. Well-carbonated and fairly light to the low end of medium bodied with a touch of creaminess. A recommended Belgian-style pale ale.

bottle from superdave 12/18/11.

hazy orange. frothy soft white head....crazy and leaves great lacing.

smells like a belgian ipa...yeast, orange, peppery spice, some grain and earthy dustiness.

tastes the same...candy, peppery spice and grass stand out. mild, dece, middle of the road.

750 ml bottle.  Pours a slightly hazy gold with a sudsy head and aromas of light lemon, a little grass and some dusty grain notes.  Flavor is light and refreshing with a decent amount of lemony edginess to it, but has a somewhat dusty grain presence that seems a little off...  This is a very good beer, but my first mild disappointment from Perennial.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Pours orange amber with white head. Nose/taste of apricot, malt, Belgian yeast, earthy hops and moderate spicy hops. Medium body. Dry spicy finish.

25.4 oz bottle.  Clear orange with a meringue head.  Nose is grass, toffee and lemon peel with hints of bubblegum.  Crisp medium light with a carb bite finishing fuzzy.  Taste is citrus pith, peel and grain with just a hint of honey ending bitter and grassy.  A nice rustic ale with spicy hop accents.
Well done. This beer is made so spot on to the style of a Hommel. Earthy spicy mellow hops. So unlike a regular American IPA. Kind of hard to believe that its made here. Good job!

Courtesy of Styles
Bottle: The aroma consists of orange, grapefruit, faint pineapple, and light Belgian yeast. It pours a transparent golden-orange with a large white head with good retention. Theres some clumpy lacing left behind. The flavor starts with light-moderate citrus with a hint of Belgian yeast. The finish has light-moderate grapefruit, light orange peel, and a touch of lemon. Its light-medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel.

Tap from munichburg tavern. Poured a darker amber color with a smaller off white head. Left lacing on the glass as it went. Aroma was grapefruit, pine and grass. Flavor was straw, grass and citrus. Hoppy finish. Medium body. Good beer.
Bottle at Gingermans w/ James after Tallest Man show.   Pleasantly surprised by this one - nice floral and herb scent.  Mouthfeel was smooth and crisp.. some more herbals, yeast

Bottle shared with Andrew at gingerman after the tallest man show. Pours a hazy orange with white lacing. Aroma is floral, spicy, herbal and zesty. Mouthfeel is medium and carbonated with notes of flowers, spice, wheat, yeast, and light hops.
Super tasty beer,  excellent work here.  I could drink this all day actually.  Fantastic body, hopping is spot on, supremely drinkable.

Draft at Fountainhead and also a bottle from a friend. Pours a deep gold, slight haze. Nose is pils sweet, odd spicy hops from the tap, much better structured from the bottle. Sort of disjointed overall. On tasting, medium bitterness with a distinct pilsner malt sweetness that betrays the balance. The yeast character is nice, moderate spicy notes that work with the hops. Not a bad beer but the draft was just a bit messy. Good from the bottle.

Bottle.  Lightly musty lemon/orange malt and orange peel aroma.  Amber color with large fluffy white head.   Lightly musty orange-lemon malt and mildly bitter orange peel hops flavor.  Nice body.  Excellent.

Bottle. Pours a light golden color with a thick frothy white head. Aroma is nicely yeasty. crisp citric character, some herbal and earthy characters, floral. Flavors are much the same, nicely sharp citrus and a balancing yeasty herbal and earthy character that lend some nice balance, touches of spice in the finish. Medium body and a crisp carbonation. Well made beer, refreshing, complex, I dig it.

750 ml pours amber with a white head. Aroma of yeast, malt, and sweet fruit.  Taste is the yeast and a sweet finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Fountainhead (Chicago, IL). Pours a rich touch dulled golden orange hue, darker with firm haze, healthy glow on the edges. A big cakey offwhite head sits atop, cakes and stays quite large, small lacing overall. Aromas are gentle spicy yeast, mellow pepper, and oranges. Some dry florals and earthy hops, touches of citrus. Mellow bready malts, some more orange, and yeasty life. A firm spice mellow dryness grows. Initial is medium bodied, a firm body with firm sweetness coming in, oranges and dry florals, gentle citrusy hop. Rich yeast, sweeter bready and gentle honey malt influence. Middle offers gentle dryness, richer yeast and fruity malt elements of pear, apple, and citrus. Sweeter middle trails off into a touch of a sticky backend, lacking dryness or refinement. Meh.. A bit sweet for my tastes

750 from Wine and Cheese place. Very nice saison/Belgian style that balances the yeast really well. A faint banana yeasty aroma topped with a well balanced yeasty body. But not too yeasty, and that sets this bee apart from other American variations. Very nice.
Bottle from Wine and Cheese Place.  Cloudy golden with nice big head.  spicy smell with bananas.  taste spices with hops in background.  Very refreshing beer with a bitter aftertaste.  Good stuff

Really a solid Belgian Ale. Nose of fruity floral citrus hops on top of spicy yeast, light grain, hay, dust. Solid. Pours golden, nice lasting frothy head. The flavor is fruity up front and throughout with a light dry hay like grain notes, a touch of sweetness, spicy light estery yeast. Floral and nice with solid bitterness and quenching power. Good shit.

Draft at the brewpub.  Nice floral hoppy aroma, served with a healthy dose of Belgian yeastiness.  Sweet, in a reserved way, lightly reminiscent of tropical fruit.  This is a fun, fully-flavorful and energetic beer, yet light and easy to drink.  Well done!  (#4498, 2/25/2012)

Tasted at the 2012 St. Louis Centennial Beer Festival from magnum bottle into sampler glass. Poured a nice, cloudy, orange-amber color with fluffy off-white foam and good Belgian lace. Strong, sophisticated aroma hops with hints of malt, bread, toast, biscuits, crackers. Hints of apricot, banana, bubblegum, black pepper and clove from Belgian yeast. Light body despite the slightly elevated alcohol percentage, lending an overall dry, "digestive" finish. A delicious style, a worthy (albeit inexplicably more expensive) clone of Popperings Hommelbier.

bottle from phaleslu.  thanks peter!   hop character is grassy, herbal, and slightly dank.  slight vegetal earthy tree note.    malts are toasted dough with a touch of caramel.   light belgian yeast fruit note.    hop forward belgian pale ale.   others seemed to like this quite a bit.   i liked it too!

Courtesy of SuperDave. Pours hazy copper with tall smooth creamy off white head. The aroma offers up Belgian yeasty spices, muted vague hops, some spicy hops and sweet apple. The taste delivers some spicy yeasty notes, spicy hop notes, some sweet apple wedges and then the addition of various spice notes that might be associated with a Saison yeast strain. Tasty brew.

750ml Bottle: Got in trade from Phaleslu; THANKS Peter!  Aroma of pale malt, Belgian yeast, hops, fruit, slight Earth, slight tropical fruit, slight citrus, and some grass.  Poured orange/amber in color with a huge, foamy, rocky, frothy, off-white head that greatly diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Very good lacing.  Flavor is lightly sweet and light to medium bitter.  Tastes of pale malt, hops, slight honey, Belgian yeast, light tropical fruit, and some grass.  Light to medium body.  Slightly dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Malt, Belgian yeast, hop, slight honey, finish is dry.
a beer that combines earthy and spicy tones from the yeast with a slight orange note contributed by the hops. Tastes great.
Clear apple juice colored pour. White head. Awesome aroma. Honey,hops, light apple and yeast. Flavor is hoppy but not bitter. Light malts, prickly carbonation. Damn nice brew.

bottle courtesy of beernbourbon, thanks! nice little belgian ipa sorta deal. nice and hoppy, and the belgian yeast adds more of a nice creamy mouthfeel than a sharp spicy one, much nicer imo. good stuff, easy to drink, nice and floral, moderate bitterness, sweet syrupy malt backbone.

tap at brewery-pours deep orange with lite hazy with a small soapy white head.  nose is floral hops lite caramel and nice tea-like qualities, probably from the hops.  lots of husky malt flavors lite citric hops-very nice balance here!  this beer has a major mineral quality that kind of tasted off to me however, it was not unpleasant enough to lower the score.  mineral qualties and herbal hop bitterness on the finish.  i really like the herbal character of this beer.  nice work!
(guest tap at Urban Chestnut) hazy gold/amber, white head. Yeasty/floral aroma. Flavor was fruit, yeast, some floral hops.

Capped 750 from Wine & Cheese in Clayton, MO. Pours hazy dark orange gold with a creamy white head. Aroma is hop with an earthy undertone. Quite promising. Med plus body. Flavor is a little citrus sour, followed by some really earthy hops and yeast/spice notes. Though I guess the earthy is also from the yeast based on the description. If the hops arent earthy tho, Im not sure what they are. Pretty good bitter! Each quaff is a pleasure to both the nose and the mouth. This is pretty good ale.

Pours hazy golden with a small white head.  The aroma has earthy floral hops, light Belgian yeastiness and is fairly dry.  Medium / light crisp body with mild amount of carbonation.  The flavor starts dry and earthy with lots of grapefruit zest and pine.  The malt is light in comparison and a bit crackery.  The finish adds spice and shows the hops well.  Really nice beer.

750 ml bottle poured a hazy golden amber with a lasting ivory head and good lacing. Aromas of biscuit, earthiness, spicy hops, citrus and light grassiness. Palate was medium bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of biscuit, earthiness, spicy hops and light citrus with a crisp dry moderatly bitter finish.

It poured a hazy golden color with a white head. The aroma was banana with some clove, light malt and wheat. The taste was banana, lemon, orange, coriander, clove, light malt, wheat and some spice hops. Plenty of carbonation.

Sampled at an esbls tasting.  I bought this one.  Hazy golden with a soapy off white head.  Sticky lacing.  A soft fruit and a spice that might come from the yeast.  Soft fruit in the flavor is apples and citrus. Bitter.  Yeast notes.  This is gentle, subtle, and nice.

Draft sample. Poured hazy golden color with a large frothy off-white head that was lasting with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy sweet malt, yeast, earthy hop aroma. Medium to full body with a slick dry texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy bittersweet flavor with a medium to heavy bittersweet finish of moderate to long duration. My expectations where exceeded with a standout change of pace brew.

Draft.  Pour is clean deep golden with a medium white head.  Aroma is lightly spicy and faintly hoppy with notes of clean nutty malt.  Flavor is also pleasantly earthy with notes of clean malt, faint spice and a nice hoppy finish.  Still early on for this brewery but this is my favorite offering so far. Very refreshing.

On draft at the brewery. Pours cloudy golden with a nice white head. Aroma piney and citrus hops, sweet malts, tropical fruits and hints of belgian yeast. Flavor is sweet malts, spicy belgian yeasts, citrus hops and orange peel. Light bodied with medium carbonation. Has a nice spicy finish.
growler... clear but bright dark gold... I get some light yeast and flowers on the aroma... easy to drink, nice offering, want to try more from them

Draft at the brewery, served in a goblet with a short stem. Pours a cloudy golden-orange color - more orange at the wider top and more gold at the narrower bottom - with a small eggshell white head. Aroma of citrusy hops, orange peel, sweet malts, piney hops, tropical fruits, and some candi sugar and subtle Belgian yeast character. Flavor of earthy hops, orange citrus, sweet malts, pineapple, and some bready, spicy Belgian yeast. Light-medium bodied, with medium carbonation and a citrusy mouthfeel with some mild bitterness. So, so nice. What a great beer to have as one of your two year-round flagship offerings.

Pour is a clear bronze with a small white head.  Aroma is a big Belgian yeast nose with some lingering sugar.  Flavor is a dry pale malt with a almost slight apple.  Finish is clean with a little spice toward the end.  A well made beer that smells fantastic.
